text.text:
My last visit Check-in Saturday and check-out sunday.

I booked 2 non AC rooms for 5 adults.

They charged non AC double bed 800 and triple bed 1200. So total 2000.

Budget friendly but I won't recommend to go here when you want to book a hotel with your family and long stays. Even I won't recommend it for couples.

If you are single and looking for cheap price and not expecting any kind of amenities you can choose here.

Below things are bad from my experience:
1. Inefficient lift
2. Hotwater not worked.
3. Wifi download speed was 0.48 kbps.
4. Towel, soap, bedsheet, shampoo, kettle, water bottle will not be provided.
5. No parking facility.
6. Congested space on road
7.  When you call for room service no one will come immediately. Especially for hotwater.

text.text:
I had an excellent stay at Taz Kamar Inn in Chennai. The hotel is located in the heart of T. Nagar, making it very convenient for shopping and getting around the city. Despite the busy area, the hotel itself is calm, clean, and well-maintained.

The room was spacious, neat, and equipped with everything needed for a comfortable stay. The facilities are modern and well-kept, and I truly appreciated the attention to cleanliness throughout the property.

What really made the experience special was the hospitality of the staff. Everyone was very kind, respectful, and attentive. A special thanks to Mr. Abdul Rauf, who went out of his way to make sure all our needs were taken care of. His helpful attitude, professionalism, and warm nature truly stood out and made our stay even more memorable.

Overall, I highly recommend Taz Kamar Inn to anyone visiting Chennai. Whether you’re here for shopping, business, or family visits, this hotel offers great comfort, value, and excellent service.

text.text: Our group stayed at room 202, 205 & 207. The standard of the rooms were atrocious. The towels were very dirty, had numerous stains and was brownish instead of white due to old age. The soap dispenser was faulty and the replacement never came even after requesting. The room service personnel were requested to clean and replace the towels and water bottles. However, they constantly did not replace these items. Furthermore, the Front Office Manager Mr Riyas was extremely rude and impolite when Ms Mahalechumi spoke with him over the phone. On the final day we checked out at 6am and when we requested for a discount since we were checking out almost half a day before the usual check out time and weren’t even taking breakfast, they denied a discount although the previous day we were told that there would be a discount. We are very disappointed with the quality of service and standard.

text.text:
Hotel is situated in a small alleyway adjacent to the SBI building near the LIC metro on Mount road.

It is not accessible by car or auto and you need to cover 150 meters by foot.

The admin was kind enough to allow us to check in earlier and checkout at 12pm

There are decent restaurants about 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel as there is not attached restaurant

The rooms are small about 9*10 and washroom is also compact

Very good for a short stay and worth the money for to its central location.

The cleanliness was a little above average.
Our room had a window open into the park which had street dogs barking all night(not for light sleepers)

There was hot water on the tap so that’s a plus.

They have an elevator to reach upper floors.

The person at the reception was courteous and kind.

text.text:
I had quite a frustrating experience at this hotel. Firstly, the location was a bit of a letdown as it didn't match the one shown on Google. To make matters worse, it's tucked away in a corner where cars can't reach, so you end up lugging your luggage quite a distance.

Moving on to the rooms, I found the quality to be disappointing given the price I paid. The attempt to create a queen-sized bed from two separate ones resulted in a night of constant bed adjustments. Not the ideal sleep experience.

The state of the bathroom was another letdown. Unpleasant smells and an overall lack of comfort made it less than enjoyable.

Perhaps the biggest letdown was the breakfast. I expected a buffet or à la carte options, but I was given just two choices. I opted for Idly, only to find out they sourced it from a nearby restaurant. Not quite what I expected for the price I paid.

Even the basics like bedsheets and pillows were not up to the mark. I could have overlooked some of these issues if I were staying at a more budget-friendly hotel, but shelling out nearly 1500 to 2000 rupees per room made the experience even more disappointing. It's safe to say the value for money here was seriously lacking.

Horrible experience!
I booked for 2 nights (made a mistake!) I checked out at 9pm coz I can't stand the place! The whole place is just not a good place to chill when in Chennai..
180yrs old Muslim Palace they say
The room is filthy you can't even lie down in bed full of bed bags! Cockroach 🪳 , ants and other insects. I got skin itching whole night till I scratched my skin too bad! Bought Cetirizine, Caladryll to heal my itchiness. I should have listened to the other reviews.
Well you get what you paid for 😱
They should renovate the place, change beddings, towels they don't even have toilet paper yikes! The whole place is scary too it's like a haunted house.
Service is also not good. The uncle guy always on the phone he don't listen to your queries he just ignored me when I asked for hot water. There's this caretaker guy who is lovely I forgot his name I think, start with "J" he is truly the best to be mentioned here..

Well , well, If you are up to a challenge being in a *colonial house" for experience yes this could be your place it gives you a lot of history 😉
Not for me though.. well unforgettable experience for me.
Pls pls avoid this place.

text.text:
Broad Lands is a quirky, heritage-rich gem—imagine stepping into a faded colonial-era hostel with open courtyards, silent rooftop decks, and vintage décor that screams “character”. The atmosphere has been called “faded colonial grandness” and “mini‑palace time travel”—it’s charming if you’re down with history, not a polished chain hotel vibe.

Total of 44 rooms. Some are AC ensuite rooms with terraces and seating—okay for comfort if you pay more. Others are basic and may lack glass windows or modern amenities.

I recently stayed at Hotel Sunpark Inn, located at No. 18, Cuddappa Rangiah Street, Periamet, Park Town, Chennai - and I had a great experience! The room service was excellent, and the rooms were well-cleaned and well-maintained.

What truly stood out was the hospitality of the hotel staff - they were incredibly friendly, attentive, and made sure all our needs were clearly heard and fulfilled.

A special mention to Mr. Dhanasekar, the manager of the hotel - he was extremely courteous, professional, and ensured a comfortable stay for us. His personal attention and warm demeanor made a big difference.

Would definitely recommend anyone visiting Chennai.

text.text:
It was a great experience for me at the Sunpark Inn. Great location. Great service. 24 hours check-out.
Mr. Dhanasekhar, Manager, is a great personality with good humour and great hospitality. He is a helpful resource if you are visiting Chennai for the first time. He guides you with every helpful suggestions.
Sunpark inn is a 3-star hotel and great for families to stay. You will get a better price if you call the hotel directly, instead of booking online. The hotel’s number can be found in google, call them and ask for Dhanasekhar, he will give you the best price.
There are also many food joints around the hotel. Walkable max 5 minutes for a biryani joint.

Wow – where do I even begin? This stay was absolutely amazing from start to finish! I honestly didn’t expect to feel this comfortable and pampered on a trip.

The room was spotless. Every day it felt like walking into a freshly made space. The attention to detail in the cleaning was next level.

What truly blew me away was the dress washing and ironing service – so professional, fast, and just incredibly helpful. I didn’t have to worry about a thing!

And the room boys… they were honestly the sweetest and most respectful people I’ve met at any hotel. So polite, so helpful – they made everything feel easy and welcoming.

You can even order food through them, and it’s delivered right to your room – super convenient, especially after a long day.

I felt completely taken care of – not like a guest, but like family. 💛
If I could give more than 5 stars, I would! I can’t wait to come back!

text.text:
I had a very disappointing experience at this hotel. We paid for 3 people, but the room provided was extremely small and could barely accommodate 2. There was only one queen-size bed, and when we asked for extra bedding, they gave only a single mattress without even a bedsheet. The toilet was broken, and the room was not properly cleaned.

The room service was the worst part — every request took almost an hour, which is unacceptable for any hotel. Overall, the service and facilities were far below basic expectations.

This place is completely misleading and feels like a fraud. Please don’t book this hotel — save your money and avoid the hassle.

text.text:
Apart from its location, everything else was a disaster. We were exhausted, didn’t have the energy to search, so we blindly booked this hotel—and wow, what a mistake. The moment we opened the door, we were greeted by over 10 cockroaches like they’d been waiting to throw us a welcome party. Bed bugs joined the fun too, just in case we thought we might get some sleep.

The bathroom? No lock. So if you're into public showers with an audience of cockroaches, this is your place. Tried to watch TV to distract ourselves—nope, just one colour: black, with an error message that probably meant “abandon all hope.”

And the blankets? Blood stains. Multiple. We didn’t know whether to sleep or file a crime report. Honestly, if you're looking for a thrill and want to waste ₹2000 a night, go ahead and book this horror movie set. Good luck—you'll need it.

This was by far the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The place was filthy, with a horrible smell as soon as you walk in. Cockroaches were crawling around everywhere, even in the rooms. There are many better and safer hotels in the area—please do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere!

I wish I could give them a negative star!!!!?

text.text:
1. Though it named as a business hotel, cockrochs are running through the rooms.
2. At night and during rains, smell from the connected ditch is coming to the bathroom and the room.
3. The entrance is narrow and congested. During rains, you can't get there since drainage water flood on the road.
4. No bottled drinking water provided.
5. Find very difficult to collect a GST bill. I had to go after that for an entire day. At the day of checkout, they made me to wait for more than half an hour but still didn't provided and after repeated reminders, somehow I collected the GST bill from them by evening. I believe they don't have a habit of giving GST bill -may be evading the tax.
Business travelers better stay away especially if you need a GST bill to claim.

text.text:
Avoid this hotel unless location is your only priority.

Stayed at Ibis Chennai City Centre for 9 nights — and it was a very disappointing experience. The A/C is locked at 24°C, and the cooling was terrible throughout our stay. No help with luggage, even during check-in or check-out. What made it worse was the rude and unhelpful reception staff — zero customer service.

The only good thing was the location — great for shopping and restaurants. But that alone doesn’t make up for the poor service, discomfort, and lack of basic facilities. Definitely not worth the price. Look elsewhere if you want a comfortable and respectful stay.

text.text: During 2010 to 2014, this hotel was very economical and had excellent service, be in terms of room and food. What shocked me mostly that after COVID, they have completely stopped their restaurant services which was its biggest HIT factor. The food was very much cooked in Bengali style and was very homely. I missed the food most and the service is no more the same. Still, if it's a long trip as you have to cut on your budget, hotel Shriram will not pinch you. Jai Maa Kali restaurant is nearby and will serve Bengalis their food purpose.

text.text:
One of the cheapest and finest Hotels in the area, we were in search of affordable hotel and we found hotel sriram its 2-3 minutes distance from the railway station. The staffs are very kind literally very kind. We stayed there for 2 nights and three days they even extended our chekout time as our train was 3 hours after our cheakout time. Loved it there you can order food from the staff directly he will cook personally. One day we ordered more food than he had cause we didn’t liked the food in the surrounding restaurants he gave his own food to us. Stay there it will be fun. Room starts at 500 for single and so on.

P.S never take auto directly they will charge you thrice the amount rather use RAPIDO at the time of arrival we were charged 150 per auto but on Rapido it was only 55. Be carefull and negotiate every where.
Thank you for reading

Great value for money though.

text.text:
Broad Lands is a budget-friendly hotel located in the bustling Triplicane area of Chennai, India. It’s known for its historical charm, having been converted from an old colonial mansion. Here are some key aspects of Broad Lands based on reviews:

1. **Historical Ambience**: The hotel retains much of its colonial architecture, providing a unique, old-world charm. This can be appealing to those who enjoy staying in places with historical significance.

2. **Budget-Friendly**: Broad Lands is well-regarded for its affordability. It’s a good option for budget travelers who want basic accommodations without spending much.

3. **Location**: The hotel is situated in Triplicane, a central part of Chennai. It’s close to the Marina Beach, one of the longest urban beaches in the world, and other local attractions. This makes it convenient for sightseeing.

4. **Basic Amenities**: The amenities are quite basic, with simple rooms and facilities. Some guests have noted that the accommodations are very modest, which aligns with the low-cost pricing.

5. **Cleanliness and Maintenance**: Reviews on cleanliness and maintenance are mixed. Some guests have found the place clean and well-kept, while others have mentioned issues with maintenance and cleanliness in certain areas.

6. **Service**: The staff is generally described as friendly and helpful. However, the level of service may not be as polished as in more expensive hotels.

7. **Atmosphere**: The atmosphere is often described as relaxed and laid-back. The hotel has a courtyard and a rooftop area where guests can unwind.

8. **Internet and Connectivity**: Wi-Fi is available but may not be very strong or reliable throughout the hotel.

9. **Noise**: Being in a busy area, noise from the surroundings can be an issue, especially for light sleepers.

In summary, Broad Lands is a good option for travelers looking for a budget stay with historical charm and a central location. It’s best suited for those who are comfortable with basic amenities and can overlook minor inconveniences in exchange for affordability and a unique ambiance.

US Visa consulate appointments: This is the place for you.

Hotel Gulnaar inn is undoubtedly one of the most affordable hotels for staying near the US consulate which offers spacious rooms and decent amenities.

I highly recommend this for people looking for a night or two stay prior to their US Visa Interview which is ~650 metres from the hotel.

The conditions of bathrooms could be improved which would entitle me to rate it 5/5.
Rest the manager and the staff are very generous with tourists.

text.text:
I had stayed here for a night with my family as my kid was attending a sports meet at the nearby Nehru stadium. Found this hotel close by and chose it to avoid travelling back and forth for the 2 day event.

I would this is a decent hotel nearby the Central station and the cost is not too costly as well. it had good parking space being in a prime location where there is hardly any space.

Check-in was smooth and our Deluxe room was in the 2nd floor. The room was really clean but felt a bit cramped with the chairs very close to the bed. The hotel is right next to the railway track and if you don't like the sound of trains passing by, avoid this hotel at any cost. But being a train lover, I loved the vantage point my room had for me to indulge in trainspotting :)

There is absolutely zero room service, no coffee or tea available. There is a Non-Veg fast food hotel operating but they don't deliver to the room too. But lot of hotels nearby and you could just walk out to have some good food outside. While passing through the corridor to the lobby, the stench of the meat being cooked is really unbearable and it just puts off so many people. If these small things can be improved, this hotel can be a great value add being in a prime location.
